column4: hey.. I get this error when transfer a zip file with nautilus
BAD FILE HANDLE
prolly broken archive
search it in google, really !!
BAD..whatever
I allready did.. find nothing useful
try creating different archives from different files, try to create extract it via command line
ok, it seems to work with other files.. but the folder I want to create a zip archive contains thausands of files
open it and moving it around within the filesystem works great within my own filesystem.. but I can't transfer it to an ftp server
how are you transferring it ? in binary mode or in ASCII mode ?
dunno.. I just transfer with nautilus
nautilus do not have FTP support, you can't use FTP
weird.. I have used it for ftp transfers for a week now.. has worked much better than gftp which crashed too much
oh, are you typing ftp://
sorry it supports ftp, I got it wrong
try ftp'ing via different client
no problem, mate
the weird thing is.. the files get uploaded.. but I get that error anyway
try a different client, use console ftp
just try a different client
ok.. I can make a .tar of the file and transfer it with no problem
so what was it ?
well it wasn't anything with the file I changed.. because the old version of the zip worked, then I made a zip with all files I changed from last time(just a few) and it worked
